questions.text: What was the nickname for Jack Diamond?
Which of the following was not a husband of Ava Gardner?
questions.explanation:
Richard Burton.

	Rooney 1942-1943, Shaw 1945-1947, and Sinatra 1951-1957.

questions.text: Whose theme song was ' It's Not Unusual '?
questions.explanation:
Tom Jones.

	Tight pants and all.

questions.text: Which of the big bands was Doris Day best known for singing with?
questions.explanation:
Les Brown.

	Joined the band in 1940 and went solo in 1947.

questions.text: What was the name of the rock and roll group led by Duane Eddy?
questions.explanation:
Rebels.

	Duane Eddy started the twang sound. He had 15 top 40 hits between 1958 and 1963.

questions.text: Natty Bumppo, a hero of novels by James Fenimore Cooper, was called all of the following except what?
Which of the following was not a heavyweight champion?
questions.explanation:
Sugar Ray Robinson.

	Sugar Ray was champion once as a welterweight and 5 times as a middleweight.

questions.text: Who wrote the Lew Archer detective series?
questions.explanation:
Ross MacDonald.

	Introduced in 1949 in ' The Moving Target '.

Ronald Reagan.

	There was an unsuccessful attempt made by John Hinkley in 1981.

questions.text: Who played Mr. Peepers on TV?
questions.explanation:
Wally Cox.

	From 1952-1955. He was a shy high school science teacher.
